alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:14PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Grafton County through 200 PM EDT... At 114 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Norwich, or 7 miles north of White River Junction, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Lincoln, Hanover, Haverhill, Canaan, Groton, Piermont, Woodstock, Lyme, Lisbon, Bath, Benton, Dorchester, Easton, Ellsworth, Wentworth, Rumney, Landaff, Sugar Hill and Orford. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 56 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern New Hampshire.
